title.content-text: 5.1.6 - The IPv4 Protocol - Packaging the Transport Layer PDU

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts how the IP packet packages the Transport Layer PDU (segment or datagram).
Step 1. Transport Layer encapsulation. The Transport Layer adds a header to the upper layer data so that segments can be accounted for and reordered at the destination.
Step 2. Network Layer encapsulation. The Network Layer adds a header so that packets can be routed through complex networks and reach their destination.
Step 3. In the TCP/IP based network, the Network Layer PDU is the IP packet.
